Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nidia L
Reviews.Content: My family and I rented two rooms mid March, 2012. We arrived at the property after midnight. We were easily admitted onto the premises by security, we found a parking spot, and made our way to the hotel. The fellows at the front desk were very pleasant, and within minutes we were in our comfortable rooms. The staff is most friendly and accommodating. The beach is ok and the poblado is quaint and fun. We felt safe and would consider staying here again. The only negative in my opinion are the flimsy, paper thin, gray looking bath towels!

Reviews.Title: “ITs a Time Share property, not a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hector P
Reviews.Content: Be aware, this is a time share property. They promote it as The Boqueron Beach Resort but really is Aquarius Vacation Club. They charge per night as a hotel but your neighbors are time share families. No hotel facilities or amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Boqueron Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: BLACKJAV
Reviews.Content: Location good and easy to find. connected from the pool area with a short walk by the river leading to the beach. On the other side, a bridge leads directly to the village and animation. Room is big and access is good. You get access to pool and facilities tothe complex. Only cons: No breakfast included. Price is not so low (actually we booked trough Hotels.com but price is 10$ higher than internet price of complex itself...Try that first!)

Reviews.Title: “If you want to go to Boqueron,this is as good as any..”
Reviews.Author: gary7272
Reviews.Content: We were there to visit what had been rated by Frommer's as one of the best beaches in Puerto Rico. Well, the beach was pretty substandard(unless you like seaweed), but obviously quite popular with the locals. As such, we spent more time than we had anticipated at the time share. First of all, the location is lovely, as it is very short walk to the beach( you get a key from the front desk that allows you to go through a fence to the beach). The neighbor complex was extremly high end as we saw huge yachts parked in front of each unit along a canal. The staff was extremely accomodating and provided cookies and juice in the afternoon. It is located quite near the stands and restaurants in the vicinity(again with the use of the provided key). It is a very attractive complex on the outside. The actual units were nothing special but very adequate for our purposes. The best part of the complex is the pool. The water was quite comfortable and the size of the pool allows for swimming laps.There is a bar/restaurant area adjacent to the pool but rarely seemed to be used. There were advertisements for a restaurant buffet all over the place, but were told that the restaurant had closed down. Overall, a satisfactory complex, though very disappointing beach...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debra360
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Puerto Rico, my family and I stayed at this resort and we were all so pleasantly surprised. The accommodations were comfortable, clean and modern. The bedding was soft and comfy! The resort was beach side, had two outdoor pools, and close to the town of boqueron. The pool side bar was everything we expected from the carribean and the food was quite good. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking to experience the beauty of the south west corridor of this beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “Good time in Boqueron”
Reviews.Author: Robear3
Reviews.Content: The time-share efficiencies are clean and efficient. You have a small kitchen, it has a microwave, coffee maker, dishes and silverwear. You have a balcony which overlooks the sea. Quite a beautiful view. Towels, shampoo/conditioner, soap, coffee is provided. They have a nice pool with a small bar. A kiddy pool is available with a slide for the little ones. It is a family-type facility and very quiet. The facility has an exercise room with a number of game machines on the groundfloor. Free Wi-Fi on floors 1-3.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep here and go to the beach”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTara
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. We reserved the studio and was pretty much satisfied with it. The room was a bit damp but I suppose that is to be expected in tropical weather. We spent just a few days here to explore Cabo Rojo, the lighthouse, Boqueron, and the beaches. The surrounding area is amazingly beautiful, the town (within walking distance) is alive with bars, restaurants, and local families walking around in flip flop sandals. A short drive away is the lighthouse and Playa Sucia, a picturesque beach. The resort was clean, the grounds were well kept, and the pool was relaxing. We didn't eat at the resort since the town was so close, we ate there instead. The next time I visit Boqueron Beach Resort I'll reserve the two bedroom, bring more friends, and stay longer. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Pjay09
Reviews.Content: I just recently visited the resort and for the price we had a really nice experience. I'm looking forward to stay again in the near future and I will recomend this resort to everyone y in search for a good experience with an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Almost paradise”
Reviews.Author: beachygal23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio unit with an amazing view from the balcony. Since it was late when we checked it, it was nearly sunset. The palm trees silhouetted against the backdrop of an evening sky and beach were just amazing. It really felt like staying in paradise. Our room was very clean, with all new furniture. The kitchenette was wonderful! We brought some food items with us and kept in the small fridge, for breakfast, the next day. The bathroom is spacious! We ate a lovely breakfast on our balcony, and enjoyed the island vista. For about $4 a person, you can take a very short drive, to the "state park" next door. They have public restrooms, public beach, campgrounds and primitive rental condos. There were food vendors like pizza, ice cream, etc, parked close to the beach. The waters were beautiful and calm. They have playgrounds for kids and picnic tables. The hotel doesn't have its own beach, just the pool (which we didn't use). Since we only stayed one night, I don't know if there is more to do in the neighborhood. We drove to Ponce the next day, to tour the art museum. Definitely give it a visit, if you are in the South of PR! We'd stay here again. *Note, if driving, be prepared for their odd parking arrangements. They park your car two to three deep, in one spot. You have to leave your keys with the front desk. So, when you are ready to leave, be prepared to wait a while, so they can move the other cars. ;-) My only complaint is that the restaurant closed at 8pm and we had no other options for food, on the property, except the vending machines. Otherwise, a great value and beautiful location!

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not bad”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelfeldmann
Reviews.Content: Not good, not bad. Excellent location, but not a very good cleanliness and, also, not a good cost-benefit ratio. I would give a grade of 6/10.

Reviews.Title: “Not Paradise but darn good”
Reviews.Author: dunhuang
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights in a 2-bedroom suite that had a large living room with kitchenette and two bathrooms. We looked west onto the beach and setting sun with a comfortable and quite large balcony. Early evening on the balcony with rum drinks was a perfect way to begin night activities. This was amazing for $110 per night. No place is perfect, and many guests did not have accommodations nearly as nice as ours. Among the hotel's other imperfections were the fact that wireless is only available in the 2nd- and 3rd-floor lobbies. Why wireless is not available in each suite defies logic. I need to use the internet daily and often, and going to the sometimes crowded and noisy breezeway lobby on the 3rd floor was far from ideal. In fact, it could be irritating at times. Other irritants included a poorly stocked kitchen, so far as cooking implements and eating utensils are concerned (We prefer to cook our breakfasts.) and the interminable wait for warm water in the shower. These annoyances aside, the charm of the town, which truly deserves to be called "funky-nice," the near-by nature reserves, the excellence of the food in town, the friendliness and hospitality of the English-speaking staff at the hotel, and the scrupulous cleaning that daily took place throughout the hotel (save for one day--a Tuesday--when our room was not cleaned or the beds made), combined to make this a real find. We highly recommend it. Now fix the wireless and kitchen issues!

Reviews.Title: “Boqueron Beach Resort, Very Good except for mattresses”
Reviews.Author: jboulet
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying our one night stay at the Boqueron Beach Resort was free. I used Delta Sky miles for the stay and had wanted to see the southern part of the island, heard the beaches were nice, and that was the reason for our stay here. For being free, I am not going to complain, it served its purpose for us. The hotel is very nice, well kept, grounds are secure (gated entrance). Pool area is nice (we did not use pool), etc. Lobby was nice. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was nice as well. Had a fridge and a sink. Nice Balcony. We got a room that had two double beds. THe mattresses on the beds were very soft, and caved in the middle. Not very good sleeping mattresses, for me at least. My wife and I by the middle of the night were in separate beds, due to the poor mattresses. Other than this one issue, the room was fine. Check In was at 4, an hour later than most hotels, and check out was at 11, an hour earlier. Any additional hour is $35. This was annoying, but the room was free, so I cannot complain. You get a special key to get to the beach and town. If you lose it, it is $100. Not a big deal just be aware of potential hidden costs. You need to sign out beach towels and return them by a certain time each day otherwise there is a charge. There is also no place to just get a cup of coffee during the day unless you go to the restaurant, if it is open at that time. My wife is a tea drinker, no tea on premises. We did not eat at hotel restaurant, it has set hours for Breakfast, lunch and dinner, and we prefer to find local spots in town. We found one, that was quite good, separate write up. La Marea

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: LillylovesPR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We were in the area, had no reservations,called and they accomodated us right away. Friendly reception. Close to beach and town. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. There was a kichenette in the room with plates, cups, utensils,coffee maker, microwave. They even included dish detergent and paper towels. Definetely a great place to stay for more than one night. The pool was great. There is a little cafe by the pool. We didn't eat there but they serve drinks and food. My only complain was with mother nature.....way too many mosquitos...oh my...of course not the hotels fault. Just bring plenty of mosquito repellent

Reviews.Title: “More amenities needed”
Reviews.Author: DixiePa
Reviews.Content: Room was nice- 2 bedroom, 2 bath- with an amazing view. However, note that half the rooms have a view of the parking lot. Front desk personnel were very nice, helpful and spoke fluent English. Had 1 dinner at the hotel's restaurant, which was delicious and very reasonably priced and our waitress was very sweet, but the restaurant was closed during the dinner hours the rest of the week. I understand that we were there during new ownership. There were only a few places open in town to eat during the week. The pool is fine, nothing special though. They have a water play area that children seemed to enjoy. Plenty of lounge chairs. Hotel provides towels. The beach is a public beach, which would be fine if you came with beach chairs, a cooler with food and drinks... When on vacation, I prefer to have lounge chairs on the beach and staff to take drink/food orders or at least places on the beach to purchase something. We only had hot water for 2 days - showering was not pleasant. Boiled water to wash the dishes. Really nothing to do in town but drink. Hotel has no activites. Went to Cabo Rojo lighthouse. Very pretty views and a beautiful beach, but an SUV/ jeep is recommended for the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Go at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: rh42
Reviews.Content: The hotel&room were nice. Had a 2 bed studio with kitchenette. Spacious bathroom. The restaurant food was delicious. Claudia (waitress) was exceptional. She's very friendly,pleasant, and goes out of her way to please. Camilo (chef) is great. Food was inexpensive. Kids pool was great adult pool was ok. Housekeeping personel were lazy. If you're not out of the room by 9:00AM, your room would not be cleaned. There were bed bugs. My legs look like a connect the dots puzzle. Told front desk about issue and they supposely sent an exterimator and changed the sheets. I still got bit. Beach isn't private and its dirty. Broken glass and trash all over. Boqueron strip on other side of marina is closed during the week. Also be careful when walking from pool area to the beach/or strip over the bridge. Be wary. There is no security nor cameras in that area. Hotel doesn't even have sufficient camera's on the grounds & none in the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Sailor234
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly greeted by the gate guard who let the hotel staff know we were coming. The room was a surprise as we didn't expect a kitchen are with dishes and microwave. The room was clean and comfortable, nice hot water for showering, lovely balcony. The pool area was very nice, although pool was only 3.5 feet deep. The beach was ok, but we gathered with a lot of people at the dock for sunset. Towns people very friendly and recommended restaurants for dinner and breakfast. We met a lot of folks from NY and MA at the restaurant. We want to return next year with our children and grandchildren.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: ECworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We went for a wedding and when we checked in on Saturday around 4 pm we did not notice anything. We quickly got dressed and went to the wedding. When we arrived at 3 am we noticed hundreds of bugs on the bed!!!! HUNDREDS!! We asked to be switched and they were very slow to respond. THey expected us to stay the night there and deal with it in the morning!! After 30 minutes, our room was switched. Bad experience and no apology.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected based on previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: jqg1956
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekâ€™s stay at Aquarius Vacation Club at Boqueron, Cabo Rojo on a Getaway from Interval International. Had tried to get it on an exchange but it never came up so we decided to book the getaway â€“ booked it a year ago and paid a very low price for a prime winter week. Lovely 2 bedroom/2 bath unit, ocean view with large balcony. Excellent front desk and housekeeping service. Both bedrooms had king beds (master with en suite bath, second bedroom with bath across the hall). This place had an adequate kitchen, although it should be noted that it is a cooktop (no oven) and that while it has service for six as to plates and cutlery, it was limited as to pots and wineglasses. Not a big deal. We mostly ate in for breakfast, and alternated lunches and dinners in and out. We were surprised to find the resort almost empty â€“ good for us since we had the beautiful pool to ourselves every day â€“ but naturally we had thought it would be crowded being prime time for the Caribbean (Week 3). After speaking with various people it was determined that this resort has mostly a Puerto Rican clientele and during the holidays and summer vacations is very popular. We had a rental car and spent a part of each day checking out the various beaches in the area â€“ Boqueron, Combate, Playa Buye and Playa Sucia. While the beaches are nice on the western part of the island, weâ€™re spoiled from visiting Vieques, Culebra and St. John and find that few live up to Flamenco Beach and Trunk and Cinnamon Bay. Note that no one told us about the bad road leading to Playa Sucia â€“ it was the nicest of all the beaches we visited, but the road to get there was full of ruts and I would hesitate to recommend it for anyone with a bad back or pregnant. The town of Boqueron itself is a quaint little village and as previously noted you can enjoy wonderful fresh clams and oysters at the kiosks. There are several nice restaurants in town â€“ we especially enjoyed LaMarea (great ceviche) and Galloways. Note that the town virtually closes up on Tuesdays, so be prepared to find alternatives for dining. We were not aware of this and ended up at Cocoâ€™s (at Aquarius) and would not recommend it. Food was mediocre (although an exceptional Mojito) and expensive. All in all, we had a terrific, relaxing vacation with temps around 85 degrees â€“ especially pleasing when calls to home advised of 1-2 degree temperatures and snow.

Reviews.Title: “just 'a place to stay'”
Reviews.Author: marckcb
Reviews.Content: the beach wasn't great, and was public access and quite crowded. the room wasn't 5-star-clean, but it wasn't terrible. the shower didn't get hot; just lukewarm. but i got the 3 bedroom suite by switching a timeshare, and the value for money was satisfactory. the pool kind of sucks (only 3.5 ft deep), but there is a good wet-playground for the kiddies. the restaurant is understaffed (waited over an hour for breakfast one day)... but the adjacent town of boqueron is oozing with charm-- fresh oyster carts line the street, dance clubs open at night, most of the tourists are puerto ricans from other parts of the island, there are AMAZING beaches a short drive away (by the lighthouse), there is fishing, scuba diving, etc. don't expect a 5 star hotel and you'll be satisfied. it's more like renting an average apartment for a while... it's not terrible, but it's not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in remote but beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: KarenArlington_VA
Reviews.Content: I don't get the bad reviews at all. This hotel was nice. Clean comfortable units, great staff, nice pools and fun area. OK, if you are looking for the white sand beaches of Cancun and all English speakers staying there, stay home. It is an awesome little resort, near a nice beach and a fun LITTLE town with good food. But you have to be willing to make an effort to fit in with the local culture, which is why we travel isn't it? The people in town and staying at the resort were largely Puerto Ricans and awesome--friendly and fun. Politest people I have been around in a while. How anyone can say there is no beach is beyond me. it is huge and nice, It was largely deserted and if you walked down a bit to get past the seaweed the water was great, calm and beautiful views. Really good meals in walking distance of the resort. Yes, there was a gate or two with a key to get in an out of the resort and the bridge to town but I never felt the least bit unsafe or like I was walking in a sketchy area because of that. Would return in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “I want to live there.”
Reviews.Author: sonia530
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, very clean, "private" beach very small though. Overall fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Aquarius was above my expectations and I would certainly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: jalcombright
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I disagree with the past few remarks made on TripAdvisor about this particular hotel. After booking my trip I found that I was very apprehensive about this particular resort. I have to say that it went above and beyond my expectations. The staff was more than helpful, friendly, willing to help. The other travellers (many locals on the weekends) were nice, spoke english and were pleasant to be around. The living area certainly was smaller than I was used to but the other aspects of the hotel made up for it. Really, how much time do you spend indoors at a place like that anyways? If you go, I would suggest definetly going to the lighthouse in Cabo Rojo, Buye Beach which is postcard picture perfect. El Combate Beach was less touristy, gorgeous though. We ate a restaurant within the village of Boqueron called Galloways, good, friendly service. Feel free to ask me any questions and I'll be happy to help if I can.

Reviews.Title: “I concur with satchNY”
Reviews.Author: gatorf150
Reviews.Content: From the pictures the Boqueron Aquarius Club looks amazing, only steps from the ocean. However, once the pool area is crossed, the locked gate opened with the single key given to the group, a 200 yard walkway down an inlet, another locked gate surrounded by razor wire and short stroll across the sand you will have arrived at the water. A quaint village full of authentic natives lies across the inlet. For just $5 (wait nevermind the sign it is now $7) you can have yourself a nice straw sun hat. On a brighter note, about 8-10 miles south is the Cabo Rojo lighthouse where some of the most tranquil and picturesque beaches surrounded by cliffs are.

Reviews.Title: “Aquarius Vacation Club”
Reviews.Author: satchNy
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Boqueron Beach in Puerto Rico the week of 3/9/09. We were a party of 7. In condo, no dishwasher, not enough dishes and glasses, table held 4, 2 cup coffee maker, onsite beach as stated, NOT. Condo advertised as sleeps 8 privately and 10 max. The beach was public and colored flags flew indicating water quality, which translated meant high bacteria counts from previous weeks rain, swim at your own risk. Cold water in pool, no hot tub, no fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: sagerick
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at Christmas and New Years in the three bedroom unit and had a wonderful time. We drove from San Juan and took the route going South and then West. It is a pleasant drive. If you know where you are going, you can probably do it after coming right of the plane in San Juan, if not it is worth it to get a good nightâ€™s sleep in San Juan. Cabo Rojo area is very nice. We arrived at the hotel and felt very relaxed immediately. The place has a calm and easygoing atmosphere, while providing excellent service. The staff is friendly without acting familiar- very professional. The property is new and spacious; the beach is safe and gorgeous. I did get burnt by what I was told was a sea anemone that must have come loose, but the water is safe, there are no big waves or currents. The views from the balconies are beautiful, we could see the sunrise over the mountains and the sunset over the sea! The units are nicely furnished, huge and clean (except for the bathtup, it had a coat of dirt in both units, so we scrubbed it ourselves). The pool area never got crowded; the pool bar has good food at decent prices with pleasant service. The beach was never crowded either. The water was so warm, we joked about having to go out to cool down. Most of the customers at the hotel are Puerto Ricans, usually bilingual. The water play structure was a big 'hit' and a great place for kids to make friends. The staff at the resort, as well as all the people in the area are genuinely welcoming. We started talking with a family in the grocery store and ended up being invited for Christmas dinner and hanging out with them for the rest of the holiday! We were invited for a day on the boat at La Parguera as well as an amazing trip through the mountains. What hospitality- we could hardly take it in! Grocery store, bakery and a strip mall where you can get pretty much anything is five minutes away in Cabo Rojo, there are also convenience stores within walking distance. A mega mall is 15 minutes away in Mayaguez. If you want to buy fresh fish, drive to Dannyâ€™s - a fishing place in Puerto Real. You have to be there around noon when the catch comes in; there should be buckets full of lobster, conch and fish of all sorts- even if you don't want to cook, the place is an experience! The front desk can give you directions. They were always friendly, patient and helpful! The area has much to explore, beaches all around and the mountains are fabulous. Boqueron is very small and the main street along the water has a grimy bar scene for college students, we took a peak and then avoided it for the rest of the time. If you want an exciting pool scene, glamorous facilities and organized activities, you should probably stay in one of the hotels in San Juan. If you want a safe, spacious and friendly place in gorgeous natural surroundings where you can spend time with your family and get to know Puerto Rico, you will enjoy this place.

Reviews.Title: “Dawning of Aquarius”
Reviews.Author: NJGirlSeeingtheWorld
Reviews.Content: My husband, cousins and I decided to go to Boqueron for a night in January 2009. We had no reservations and my cousins (who live in Puerto Rico) knew of Aquarius, but had never stayed there. So, we called and were told they had availability: a studio-style room with two full beds for $119 or a suite with two bedrooms with king beds for $189. We reserved the studio-style (the four of us agreed to save a little). Upon arriving and seeing how great the grounds looked, how secure the resort was, and how close it was to the Poblado (center of town) and beach- we asked at check-in if we could get the two bedroom suite and for two nights. It was no problem at all. We were given suite 505A- which has an amazing view of the beach. (Half of the suites do not face the water, but the parking lot). When we walked into the suite, we were so impressed- living room, kitchen (with washer dryer), and long balcony. The one â€œmasterâ€� bedroom had a door out to the balcony with an attached bathroom with Jacuzzi. The other room was a little smaller with a bathroom right across the hall without balcony access. All the rooms were decorated in a modern design and felt very â€œhomeyâ€�. All that for $189!!! The beds were super comfortable. Everything was clean and smelled fresh. The location is amazing- you are given a key to the back gate ($100 value if you lose it), which leads to the beach and Poblado. The Poblado has great nightlife (restaurants, barsâ€¦and a great spot to catch sunsets). The gate guarantees that none of the drunken or unsavory types have access to the resort. The beach is great- and easily accessible. The pool is very pretty. For people with children, it has a kiddy pool/slides. The restaurant is open all day and the food is good. It also has a bar open all day with Happy Hour specials. Hint- if you are offered a â€œfreeâ€� lunch, be aware that it comes with a hitch. You can purchase time share at Aquarius, so a pitch comes with the free lunch. We passed on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: eddie3500
Reviews.Content: Was there Last week Of Nov,2008 It was great check in went so easy,the staff very nice,My smoke alarm was not working I called and within 8 min were in my room fixing the problem. I had a 3 bedroom Villa which was very clean,the Pool is only 3 1/2 feet deep good for kids, The Bar & Grill at the Pool is Good, Good food for a reasonable price, Try the Fish Balls just like Ckicken Nuggets lol If U walk over the Bridge by the Marina U will have a small Village which is really cool some bars and food , Good Fresh Sea Food Callaways but check your Bill they sometimes try too add extra fees, It happen too me but it was good,Long Drive from San Juan The Beach was not really a beach to me,I am used too the Beach In Isle Verde PR 5 mins from the airport,This a family resort For Single People Not Reallyl

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: afjoe1
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We rent the main condo and the connecting room to make it a three bedroom. It had a full kitchen and a small limited kitchen in the third room. It had three bathrooms which was perfect for the amount of people we had staying there. It is a great family resort also good for younger people to stay at. It is in a short walking distance to the beach and the downtown village which has a great nightlife. Overall, great times. You don't get housekeeping everyday but they do exchange towels and bed linens upon request. They also do one deep cleaning if you are there for more than 4 days.

HotelInfo.Name: Aquarius Vacation Club
HotelInfo.Address: Carretera 101, Acceso Balneario Km 18, Boqueron 00622, Puerto Rico
